website_summaries.verdict: Evviva's illuminated ant farm uses a nutrient-rich gel instead of sand, and the blue LED display is visually appealing.
pros: LED lights encourage more exploration and tunneling
Blue gel is easier to control than sand
Includes a magnifying glass for observation
Gel is packed with nutrients for sustained colony growth
cons: Enclosure is poorly ventilated, gel can develop mold

customer_reviews.title: Should be considered animal cruelty. Molds, and ants just stood around til they died.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome if you are sick and love watching suffering. We followed instructions exactly! The ants did NOT like it AT ALL. They just stood around huddled together waiting to die.... which they did, one at a time. The only time they moved at all is to move the dead ants into a pile. Seriously, this should be considered animal cruelty. I am glad they didn't send a queen, because we let the poor survivors go so they could live out their sad little lives in the sunshine, and real dirt in our backyard. Also, the weird blue wetish gel molds. DO NOT get this ant farm!
customer_reviews.author: Haley Crayton

customer_reviews.title: Ants quickly died
customer_reviews.text: The ants got sick and died quickly (in less than two weeks, more than half in less than a week). There was not enough air, the ants would try to crawl to the air hole and and pump their abdomens to try and fill their spiracles with enough air to live. We added more holes, but ended up having to remove the lid multiple times a day when we would notice all of the ants “sleeping” for hours at a time. There didn’t seem to be enough nutrition or moisture in the gel either. It was sad and terrible to watch them get sick and die.
customer_reviews.author: J K.

customer_reviews.title: The poor things just wait to die
customer_reviews.text: Did 2 batches of ants. No tunneling occurred. They just huddle and die. Some die fast. Others linger for many days without moving much as if they are conserving energy. Enclosure has no air holes. When I take the top off and blow on them, they become animated for a time. Very sad. I'd like to just put them out of their misery. Update 2/3/2019 Today I took the top off and left the farm on it's side under the trees. They have no queen so won't reproduce biting bugs in the yard. Better to die out there than in some plastic environment.
customer_reviews.author: Language Learner

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Great small and farm. Ordered one for my son for his insect study merit badge. he set it all up himself and made it work fine. Ants love the gel and really started boring through it. He liked it so much he ordered a second. Individual ants don't live forever but more than a month. My son found if you alternate days of the light they rest more and tend to live longer. He liked watching them and doing all the work. No maintenance except occasional carcass removal and that's easy as the ants stack them in the corner.
customer_reviews.author: Sabot

customer_reviews.title: NO AIR, ANTS ARE DYING !!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought that container. I received super ants all alive, put them in the container. At first they were happy digging. Then they stopped, 2 died on day 2. 2 dies on day 3 (and I had started to leave the lid partially open so they would get more air. They pretty much stopped making tunnels. I am going to remove the lid and put some tape with holes so maybe they can survive. If more start dying I'll release the rest of them outside and throw away this deceptive ant trap.
customer_reviews.author: French lady

customer_reviews.title: Ants were not interested.
customer_reviews.text: The concept and visual effects (the blue gel and under lighting) was impressive and this lead me to purchase this item. However, the reality was not impressive. The ants were not interested in digging into the gel and were more interested in getting out of the enclosure. After a day, they were looking very hungry so I put food in the enclosure and they were very happy. 4 days later, still no digging so I decided to buy a traditional sand-based ant farm. Hurray, success.
customer_reviews.author: wendy p.

customer_reviews.title: Not sure about this gel...
customer_reviews.text: Within a couple of days, most of my ants died. A few are left and they don't appear to be long for this world. They are just sort of sitting on each other, inert. I hope they're not suffering. A few dug from the side to the bottom on the first day, and tunneled about an inch before going to meet their maker. None paid any attention to the three tunnels I started for them. I've ordered more ants and noticed the gel at the top is starting to turn from blue to green. I wonder if it's infected.
customer_reviews.author: Picky

customer_reviews.title: Super cool
customer_reviews.text: I don't know who's enjoying this ant habitat more–my four-year-old daughter–or me! The ants have been working hard tunneling since I introduced them to their new home a month ago, and show no signs of letting up. We keep the light on no longer than six hours/day max (recommended to avoid condensation forming on the inside). Opening the small portal on top every day for 30 seconds to let fresh air in and circulate seems to be a good idea as well. Just keep an eye open for escaping inhabitants, as they scurry! It's a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Hayden

customer_reviews.title: Going Smoothly
customer_reviews.text: We got it a month ago and the ants are still alive. But that's probably because my son got the ants from the woods outside, instead of ordering them. The ants go through a lot during shipping, so by the time you get them they are probably not very healthy. We recommend getting your own ants from outside. They were fun and easy to capture. None of them have died yet, and they have four or so tunnels so far.
customer_reviews.author: Dewdrop

customer_reviews.title: Is it an ant issue or habitat problem?
customer_reviews.text: The ants, which I want to clarify DID NOT come from this company, we’re added to their habitat as soon as they arrived. They all seemed quite confused and groggy. When they started tunneling they were pretty lazy about it and after about a week they started crawling down the side of the enclosure and didn’t even try to tunnel. The boys 5 and 7 were excited at first but quickly lost interest. After a few weeks all the ants were dead so we emptied the gel and will try again one more time next year with free ants from the backyard.
customer_reviews.author: Divita's Mom

customer_reviews.title: leaving my ten year old very sad and disappointed
customer_reviews.text: We followed the instructions meticulously, started tunnels for them, watched them everyday, and they never tunneled never did anything but try to escape and were all dead within a week, leaving my ten year old very sad and disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: "chadandlia"

customer_reviews.title: Great fun for the whole family.
customer_reviews.text: What a fantastic gift for children, and that includes my wife. They all enjoy watching the ants dig through the translucent gel, making tunnels and nests. The blue light at the bottom makes everything easy to see. We purchased this unit in June and it's now October; the ants are still thriving. My only suggestion is to offer a larger model so the tunnel networks would become bigger and more intricate. Great fun!
customer_reviews.author: Asfor

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to obtain ants for the farm, before giving as a gift!
customer_reviews.text: This was bought as a gift for my 9 year old grandson. He was very excited to receive it . However, he was disappointed there were no ants included as I was waiting for temp in our region to be less than 85 degrees. His mother went ahead and ordered live ants despite our temperature being over 85 and received the ants. However, she misread instructions included in their ant farm and left the ants in the refrig for an hour. Needless to say, only 6 survived their ordeal. I will order another refil at a later date.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Kern

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Learning lots!
customer_reviews.text: Ant Farm arrived quick; separate order for ants arrived 2 days later. Easy to setup; easy to add ants (you refrig them for only 10 min and they become very docile/sleepy and wake back up after being in tank for a bit). Love the light! Love the size.... (small)....doesn't take up a lot of room. Very pleased. Ants like the gel. We did use the stick provided and did starter holes; like 5-6. Great purchase; comes with free ant ebook that is perfect for learning and includes links. Young teen son loves it and can't stop watching them.
customer_reviews.author: Expat_USA

customer_reviews.title: Once you go gel, you always go back.
customer_reviews.text: The ants would not dig into this at all. This is the second gel farm I have owned, the ants tunneled into the last one after a few days but always seemed to not like the gel and were always covered in gel debris. Not wanting to dump the ants in the yard I emptied this one and filled both with dirt. The ants started digging in the dirt right away. They do not like the gel. Please consider getting a dirt/sand ant farm instead of gel.
customer_reviews.author: TheHandiCapperGeneral

customer_reviews.title: Nice ant farm for your budding ant farmer.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son's 9th birthday; he's recently been obsessed with getting an ant farm (he watches lots of Youtube videos about ant keepers). He has been extremely happy with this ant habitat. We ordered a tube of harvester ants from amazon as well and the ants seem happy and are digging down in the gel. Great product, it was very easy to set up, and is a really nice starter set for a kid who thinks he's going to set up ant farms all over the house after watching some guy on Youtube. (We're hoping he doesn't want any other sets). I would definitely recommend this Ant Farm.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Powell

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gift for little ones!
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old loves ants and got this for her birthday. I ordered the ants and we put them in frig for 10 minutes - ours started working within minutes. We've had it for 2 months and they are still very active and incredibly interesting to watch. It's small and easily portable (she brought them to preschool one day) - everyone who comes over finds them fascinating.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Something wrong with this ant farm...
customer_reviews.text: Ants arrived alive... Still have some living ants in the original shipping tubes as I had ordered a double order of ants "just in case" because this was a gift for my grandson. But all the ants which were placed in this gel ant-farm died. They did dig for a while (one nice tunnel) but first all the ants in the tunnel died and then the others got lethargic and died. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Careful Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: It's been less than 48 hours since my ants arrived, but they have already dug multiple tunnels and are busily constructing more as I write this review. All but one ant arrived alive. I put them in the refrigerator for about 20 minutes and then poured them into the waiting "farm." Other than about 90 seconds to set up the light assembly, that was all there was to it. So simple, affordable (the ants were only $5.00, including shipping and tax), and fascinating to watch for all ages. My grandkids, ages 2, 4 and 7, all enjoy it, but I think I'm having the most fun of all watching them!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy R.

customer_reviews.title: Ants drowned
customer_reviews.text: This is a miserable failure. I bought one and condensation builds up so bad the ants drowned at the bottom of the tunnels they dug. I emailed the company and they sent me a 2nd, identical one. Same thing. Condensation is building up so bad I have been removing the lid some to let it dry out. Needless to say, half of the ants escaped now. DO NOT BUY. Update: we tried our second one the company sent and the same thing - the condensation builds from the moist gel and the ants die. Thankfully, this one was free and my only loss is time.
customer_reviews.author: Santos Rosario Estrada-Perez

customer_reviews.title: So exciting at first, so sad at the end
customer_reviews.text: We had some large ants in the back yard and the kids gathered at least 30 and put them in without too much trouble. My 4 kids aged 2-9 loved watching the ants dig. They took this on vacations to continue watching. It is beautiful and the blue glow at night is a good night light. I just personally am a bit disturbed by all the dead ants which inevitably will be piled up by the living until there is horribly only a few living left among the dead. What a way to go. I’m also left with what to do with the old ant farm now...another project.
customer_reviews.author: JSAAII

customer_reviews.title: I don't know
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 60 ants and they all died within a month. Light is very bright. A really cool idea, but ants are dead and will have to buy more. Plus they moved all the dead ants to the top and the live ones burrowed at the very bottom of gel. Had to take the light off to see them. Like I said tho, all of the ants are now dead.
customer_reviews.author: Hedkase

customer_reviews.title: It was a great experience for my son and my daughter
customer_reviews.text: This set is everything and more. It was a great experience for my son and my daughter. The LED lights at the bottom really helped to see the ants in their work environment. Great, Great product. I would highly recommend. BTW, the lights do take a bit to warm up, so if you plug them in and the lights don't come on, they aren't broken, they will soon be on.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: Ant Farm Parade!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves her ant farm and gave her best friend this ant farm as well for a birthday present. They both "walked" their ant farms in a 4th of July Pet Parade. (they dressed as farmers). We have definitely gotten our money's worth out of this ant farm. That's for sure! (FYI, if walking in a parade with your ants, or taking them outside, make sure to keep the hole on top open to prevent condensation)
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Killed the ants. Went back to regular farm
customer_reviews.text: It is a cute set up. The ants hate it. We have to give them extra air all the time or they become lethargic and dont move. They do not burrow. They did 1 tunnel to bury the dead. The rest just sit on top waiting to die. Wont buy this again will go back to the sand one. They were way more active and had more air. They also dont like the feel of gel they climb on top of one another to get away from it. And you can watch them cleaning themselves and each other. Transferred the ants after several died.
customer_reviews.author: Kjmccormick

customer_reviews.title: Would give 5 stars if it weren't for ...
customer_reviews.text: Sending me an opened box. The items have been displaced, box torn and opened. Everything looks to be in working condition so I'm not going to return it. The LED light is pretty cool and it's not too big to take up a lot of space. My daughter definitely thinks it's really cool. Now we just need to order the ants!
customer_reviews.author: Chanel

customer_reviews.title: The 21st Century Ant Farm!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas present for a 10 year old, and what attracted me to it is that it’s the 21st century version of the ant farm! With its blue gel that the ants make their tunnels in and the lit up base, this makes it a very unusual gift. I know this is going to excite the young felllow tremendously. Evviva was a great company to do business with.
customer_reviews.author: AMH

customer_reviews.title: fun gift
customer_reviews.text: My son loves ants. Once we received our ants (which happened quickly and all arrived alive) we followed the instructions with great success. Our ants started tunneling that same day and have been making steady progress for the past week. We are really enjoying watching the habitat and all the hard work our ants are putting in. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: jeannine

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for us.
customer_reviews.text: This ant farm did not work out for us. Set it up on 12/24 with our son. The ants dig for the first two days then stopped. Several days without them moving mg husband put an orange in the farm. The ants stayed on the orange for a few days and didn’t move again. Let the ants out in our backyard tonight and they crawled away. Not sure what went wrong but wishing we went with the sand version.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: I have to agree with the other reviews on here. I bought this for me 11 year old as she has a fascination with bugs and thought this would be something for her to do while we are all quarantined. As soon as she put the ants in most of them dropped to that side part and died. I felt bad because she was so excited to get this. She is making the best of it but there is definitely some issues.
customer_reviews.author: Willowrayne

customer_reviews.title: My son is loving his new little microcosm
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little habitat--and great company to work with. Our set initially was missing the power cord. I messaged them and received a replacement the next day..seriously. We've had no problems. I picked this set after my 7-year-old son ran into some youtube videos a week or so ago and was going on and on about ants and their behavior and I thought, "he's never had an ant farm." I waited until he got home from school to surprise him and he was hooked. He now keeps the habitat next to his computer desk and updates us on their daily progress. Very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Charles D

customer_reviews.title: Great product for family and classroom.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our 5 year granddaughter's upcoming birthday. I gave it to her early because I couldn't wait to see the ants in action. Her mother (our daughter) has the same set up in her first grade classroom. It is fascinating to watch these little guys. Very easy to set up and there is no feeding or watering as the gel provides all nutrients. Great product and wonderful vendor service. I purchased the double set of ants.
customer_reviews.author: bulroy

customer_reviews.title: Great product and great customer service!!!
customer_reviews.text: First if all, the ant habitat is compact and looks very modern and sleek! The blue LED looks terrific! My LED light burned out after a day or so. The customer service at Evviva Sciences was out of this world and truly exceeded my expectations! They worked around my busy travel schedule to deliver a brand new habitat during the short window for being home. Craig, the representative, was super kind and helpful. Great product and great customer service!!!
customer_reviews.author: POW REVIEWER

customer_reviews.title: BEST Customer Service and Product!
customer_reviews.text: I'm extremely impressed with this habitat and even more impressed with Evviva Sciences. They have, by far, the best customer service I've ever experienced. The habitat is beautiful, and the ants are thriving, but I did experience a bit of an issue with the lighting device. I informed Evviva Sciences and they sent a full replacement right away that is working beautifully. It was a complete pleasure to work with them and I 100% recommend this habitat. It's been a little over a month now, and although there were a few ants that didn't make it through shipping/transitioning to the gel farm, the rest are doing extremely well. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica G.

customer_reviews.title: Ants got to work immediately!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my 4 year old son who has always been facinsted by ants outside. We ordered the ants off a separate website online. Make sure you're getting harvester ants as they are the best for tunnelling etc. Per the instructions I mad three holes to get them started and they got to work immediately. It's been less than 24 hours and they already have a huge tunnel going down the side and another splitting into two. Our 4 year old loves it and we do too!
customer_reviews.author: TheScoob

customer_reviews.title: Very Fun & Mesmerizing!
customer_reviews.text: Very cool. Whole family is enjoying it, and a couple of neighbors too. We loaded it with about 40 harvester ants that we harvested a couple of blocks from our home. We used popsicle sticks and a large Tupperware container to collect. Then inserted a small funnel in the top and used the popsicle sticks again to get them in about 2 at a time by lightly scraping them in without getting dirt mixed in. They started digging almost immediately. Per instructions, we helped with a couple starter holes 1/4" deep or so. No dead ants and they are all very active and fun to watch work. Enjoy!!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Poor Ants
customer_reviews.text: Was excited to get this for my son. The problem is the gel seems to collect too much moisture and become too gooey? Started out good and now it looks like the ones in the bottom tunnel are dead and trapped. The gel looks like it has melted or something. It has been inside away from the sun at a consistent 75 degrees. Real bummed out after spending $30 for the farm and another $15 for the ants.
customer_reviews.author: Mike P.

customer_reviews.title: The sellers are great about providing customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought the ant farm for my 7 year old grandson, who loves it, but so does the rest of the family ! It sits on the shelf in the living room so that everyone can watch and keep up on how far the ants have dug that day. My grandson has been studying the habits of ants and has shared some interesting facts. The blue gel and the LED lights just make this ant farm so much more interactive. The sellers are great about providing customer service, too.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene R. Steffy

customer_reviews.title: Best ant habitat
customer_reviews.text: Great little habitat for ants. This is the only habitat that our ants are thriving in. The others were sandy substrates. I love that I don't have to water and feed them. The kids can see more detail in the tunnels they dig as well as on the ants themselves. They even sent us a e-book full of info and fun experiments too. Deffinatly going to buy the refills here.
customer_reviews.author: LadyHummyByrd

customer_reviews.title: My boys love this thing.
customer_reviews.text: My 5 and 7 year old boys love this ant farm. They love the LED lights as a night light in their room and they're always excited to check out the ants when they get home from school. The gel eco system is easier to maintain than a sand/dirt environment. They love watching the ants work and the new tunnels the ants build. It's worked out great and I would definitely recommend it to anyone with curious children.
customer_reviews.author: KiltedSlinger

customer_reviews.title: Excellent present for curios kids and families with the desire ...
customer_reviews.text: We got it for our son's 11th birthday last weekend. He has had it for almost a week and loves seeing how the ants dig their way through the gel to the bottom of the habitat. It took the ants a little over a day to understand their new home and soon started digging. 6 days into it they have almost made it to the bottom in 3 separate holes being dug. Excellent present for curios kids and families with the desire to learn!
customer_reviews.author: D.I.

customer_reviews.title: So cool!
customer_reviews.text: The first Ant Cosmos Kit we received had a faulty plug and one of the lights wasn't working... Evviva sent me a new one quickly, at no extra cost to me, and even asked me to contact them upon receipt and they would send me new ants, again and no cost to me, and they did! Awesome customer service... not common these days, so I was pleasantly surprised. These ants dug and dug, and the habitat is beautiful and mesmerizing! My kids love looking at it while we eat. We keep it on the dining table. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Angela Van Dellen

customer_reviews.title: A great little ant farm!!
customer_reviews.text: This ant farm has been fantastic! I got it for my daughters birthday and we immediately put the ants in. For the first few days they didn't do anything and I was getting pretty concerned. But by the fourth day we had the beginnings of a tunnel!! Once they start digging there is no stopping them!! All of the ants are still living and healthy as can be and there are about 6 tunnels. It is so much fun for us to check each day and see their work. The lights really do help too! The ants made a tunnel right down to each bulb at the bottom! I would definitely recommend this ant farm :)
customer_reviews.author: Laura Beth

customer_reviews.title: This ant farm is great; the first I've owned
customer_reviews.text: This ant farm is great; the first I've owned. I bought it for a camp I'm teaching and thought the children would love to see the ants make their tunnels. It probably says on the packaging and I didn't read it closely enough, but I thought it would be bigger. So I was a little disappointed about that aspect. All the lights work, the ants began tunneling within 48 hours. I love that you don't have to feed and water the ants with the blue gel.
customer_reviews.author: tkwhitaker

customer_reviews.title: Ants Didn't Tunnel
customer_reviews.text: This ant farm didn't function as claimed. Ants just congregated on top of gel with no attempt to form tunnels. After 2 weeks of watching ants slowly die off, I finally gave up and bought a conventional sand ant farm for my grandson. I moved the remaining live ants into the new sand ant farm where they appear to be thriving, and trashed the gel farm.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Johansen

customer_reviews.title: A 9 year old’s review...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for Isaac who is 9 years old, and this is his review: “I would recommend Amazing Ant Habitat. A really good thing about it is the directions were very easy to follow. Another good thing about it is, when you move it, the tunnels won’t fall because of the gel. The light makes the gel glow which is really cool. One suggestion is you should make the air hole smaller so the ants don’t get out. Overall it was really good!!”
customer_reviews.author: debra

customer_reviews.title: Great observational habitat
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this ant habitat for my sons to enjoy and they really have! We ordered the ants separately and followed instruction to get them into habitat. It was seamless and the ants are still active! The kids love to watch them and we read the informational booklet that comes with the kit. Ants are really cool insects for kids to observe. The habitat is sturdy and secure, plus we can see them so well with the blue light! I recommend this for anyone with budding scientists or curious kids at home!
customer_reviews.author: Amy M Rich

customer_reviews.title: So so gift
customer_reviews.text: Super neat gift but didnt last as long as I'd hoped. Gets nasty as the ants die and tunnel all they can tunnel. Son enjoyed while it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal H.

customer_reviews.title: Common carpenter black ants does not eat it at all!
customer_reviews.text: My black carpenter ant colony with the queen do not dig holes (I have poked starter holes) and do not eat it as food. They walk around dying one by one, and the queen stopped laying eggs. I will transfer them back into a test tube with half filled as water separated by a cotton ball, and the opening closed by another cotton ball. The ants loved that.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Fun & educational for kids & adults
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old daughter, my husband and I have been completely fascinated with this farm. It's easy to set up and comes with very detailed instructions on ant care. 95% of the time is observation alone and we truly enjoy it. Visitors end up watching them too. It's fun to watch the little workers so their thing right in front of your eyes. I'd highly recommend this as a gift for children that love critters, nature and exploring.
customer_reviews.author: MrsMot

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and Service!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Cosmo ant farm for my 7 year old and he loves it. We had to order the ants separately and when I was confused on how to do so I reached out to the company for advice and not only did they do the order for me they gave me step by step instructions on how to put the ants in and what to do next for a most positive outcome as well as follow up to see if all is well with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Day

customer_reviews.title: This is a great gift and I will be buying another one when ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my nephew's birthday who turned 4. I had it shipped to his home and it arrived in a matter of days. My sister in law ordered the ants separately since they don't live in the same state as we do and temperature differs from where we live. Once the ants arrived and they set it up, my nephew (and the rest of his family) was totally entertained with watching the ants build their tunnels which only took about a day! He absolutely loves it. This is a great gift and I will be buying another one when our own son is old enough!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ants are still alive two weeks later
customer_reviews.text: They don’t move much but we accidentally put a piece of apple in when they didn’t need any food so they just hang out on the apple instead of building tunnels but they are still alive and the light is a nice feature
customer_reviews.author: chrissy meyers

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: A great idea for little kids! It looks cool and it’s super simple to assemble and maintain. The best part was the customer service I received from Craig. I was having some issues with my farm and ants and he went above and beyond to help me remedy the problem. I’d recommend this product based on the customer service alone.
customer_reviews.author: The Zola

customer_reviews.title: Really awesome set up
customer_reviews.text: Really awesome set up. I wish the top lid would secure better. I used tape as it can get knocked over. It's still pretty sweet. I rigged mine with scotch tape. There's no way for the ants to escape, but the top lid doesn't latch in any way making it easy to knock off and free the ants to their new nest, your house. 😊 I still love it; it's the coolest any far I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: edhead76

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Ant grave, no tunneling, just a slow death with multiple attempts.
customer_reviews.author: Adrianna

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: My 10-year-old daughter loves this Ant Cosmos Kit. We had a little trouble getting healthy ants, but Craig from Evviva Sciences went above and beyond to make sure this habitat worked for us. Best customer service!
customer_reviews.author: fishboy7779

customer_reviews.title: Awesome looking and fascinating ant farm! What a great gift!
customer_reviews.text: Really an awesome product. This was a Christmas gift for my brother (he's 27). He was SO excited. When he was about 9 years old he was on vacation and I fed his ants chocolate syrup and they all died. He was so bummed. Now he gets to finally see them continue to build! I shot some video of these guys with a macro lens adapter and was SO fascinated. You can see the ants pulling the gel apart because of the clear gel. Also, the manufacturer coupon was great and the ants were all alive except for two. I will probably get one for myself at some point :).
customer_reviews.author: Bob Holliday

customer_reviews.title: The gel killed the ants I had and is not ...
customer_reviews.text: The gel killed the ants I had and is not suitable for long term ant keeping. A sand/ dirt habitat is much more suitable for ants based upon the research I have done. This habitat is for short term ant keeping only Two stars because customer and return was excellent
customer_reviews.author: R. C.

customer_reviews.title: Good ant farm
customer_reviews.text: Really nice one but understand the top comes off there is no latch or button so best to keep somewhere it will not get knocked off or pryed open by little ones. The light is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa A. Chappell

customer_reviews.title: Super easy, great for little kids
customer_reviews.text: To say my kids are obsessed would be an understatement. These little guys started tunneling as soon as they got comfortable, after they buried their dead. Within a few weeks, the entire thing is full of tunnels and very busy ants. Zero maintenance except opening up the breathing hole on occasion.
customer_reviews.author: L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Almost a year later, and still 8 ants are alive
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our daughter last Christmas, ordered ants, and got them in early Feb. I read some reviews about mold and the ants dying quickly. We ordered about 20 ants, but we still have about 8 alive 10 months later, which I think is quite impressive and I never thought they would last this long.
customer_reviews.author: John C Stringer

customer_reviews.title: Good kit!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good kit and bright LED's. In Orlando, FL, it is very hot and humid. Although I keep my home at 76 all the time, but I have to open the lid every day to keep the humidity down and avoid droplets building up inside. Seems it could use one or two more air holes to help ventilation.
customer_reviews.author: Neurotico

customer_reviews.title: Up Town Living Quarters For Your Ants !
customer_reviews.text: This Habitat is outstanding! Unlike some other habitats, there is no need to make the gel. It's there and ready to go,just add ants. The ants go right to work digging tunnels. The light is bright and very pretty at night. Well worth the price and a super gift for young children. You do have to avoid the ants biting. There bite is pretty substantial.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Becker

customer_reviews.title: Great learning experience
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves it. I see other reviews that are bad but my grandson loves watching them tunnel. He's had it for about a month and its still working fine. I purchased a book to go along with it so now he can understand what's going on in the ant world.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Cornwell

customer_reviews.title: Kids love watching the ants illuminated by the bright blue light!
customer_reviews.text: My kids were thrilled how the bright blue light illuminates the ants working in their tunnels. Very low maintenance as the ants are able to eat and get moisture from the gel. Also I received great customer service from the seller. I contacted them once, and had my issue resolved right away.
customer_reviews.author: eileen n.

customer_reviews.title: Cool
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work for us. Cool looking farm, but the ants we used didn’t take to the gel. Ended up being a ant burial plot and all the decaying moisture fogged up the whole thing. Trashed it
customer_reviews.author: MDHawk89

customer_reviews.title: Fascining to watch the ants!
customer_reviews.text: Great product and gift. Bought this for my son’s 7th birthday and it was definitely a hit! I think my husband and I enjoyed watching the ants as much as the kids did. It’s fascinating to watch the ants dig tunnels and connect them. The kit is well constructed, a perfect small size, and the light is an added bonus. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Collected Large Ants, Ants did not Escape
customer_reviews.text: We collected large red ants from the same colony (we followed all instructions in the kit), they began digging right away... they now have 2 tunnels & 3 pits, kids really love looking at it every day.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Roome

customer_reviews.title: Many accolades for this gift
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a birthday gift for my son's friend back in May. At the end of September, I received from his mom: "Just had to write and tell you the ant farm lasted this long. We are down to 1 last any. Again just such a great gift. The whole family loved it." I already put one on my son's Christmas list :)
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: Great service and product!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product and loved the service we received from the Evviva Sciences Company! We initially had a hard time getting our ants to dig, but Craig was quick to email us back with trouble-shooting ideas which worked! This is a great company to work with!
customer_reviews.author: db

customer_reviews.title: Gel is the way to go. All you need. Ants are separate though!
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this (6 and 4) and honestly so do i. The ants have done great in here so far. They work tirelessly to build their tunnel system. It’s extraordinary to watch. The led lighting system is awesome. The gel is Way better than the sand i remember growing up.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Crouch

customer_reviews.title: It was OKAY!
customer_reviews.text: The ant farm is pretty cool. We all enjoyed watching the ants tunnel thru the blue gel. Each day there was a new tunnel. After a week some of the ants died (no tell why) but after more and more died we got concerned. We've had the farm for 3 months and only 3 ants are left out of 20-25 ants. Why are they dying?! This was a short lived nice experience. Now I have to throw away the entire farm. I doubt if putting more ants in a tomb would be beneficial to the new comers.
customer_reviews.author: Peace Haven Childcare Center

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift for my niece. She absolutely loves it! It is so fun to be able to see through the habitat because of the lights. Never seen anything like it!
customer_reviews.author: Alex's mommy

customer_reviews.title: and the gel is much better than the sand filled version I had as a ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 5 year old. She has been fascinated by it. She loves checking for progress on the tunnels each day. The product is well made, and the gel is much better than the sand filled version I had as a kid. If you're looking for live ants, I ordered mine from antsalive.com. The cost was lower than anything I could find on Amazon. The ants and the farm have been great.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Lish

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool
customer_reviews.text: My son begged for a ant farm. He chose this one. It is nice that the ants get all their food and water from the gel. The only thing I was shocked by was it was so small. It is approximately the same size as a paperback book. But other than that, it is pretty cool. My son loves it!
customer_reviews.author: D mcentee

customer_reviews.title: Both my boys have really enjoyed this and I had to order another one for ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my younger son just to watch and when my son from college came home for the weekend he took it back to school with him. Both my boys have really enjoyed this and I had to order another one for my younger son. It is lit up really well and very interesting to watch them work. In the photo is does not look sturdy but it is very sturdy and well built. Thanks for the great product and fast service.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Stuckey

customer_reviews.title: but the seller has great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than expected, but the seller has great customer service. My ants were slowing down and I asked the seller. Seller gave great tips on how to encourage the ants and also offered replacement if their tips did not work. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Milota

customer_reviews.title: Great present
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas present for my boys. We got our own ants from the backyard. They love to observe the ants digging tunnels in the habitat. The light makes it look very pretty.
customer_reviews.author: momof3

customer_reviews.title: Ants not included
customer_reviews.text: If u give this as gift get it early and then to get ants. It’s not as fun of gift when they open. It and have to wait for ants in mail. Works great. Love the lights
customer_reviews.author: Ninjamama82

customer_reviews.title: Observation of nature
customer_reviews.text: The Ant Farm has a pleasing design, and the LED lighting enhances it. It appears to be sturdy overall. Directions for "ant maintenance" are easy to comprehend. I think encouraging any child to become interested in nature is important, so I would recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Linda M. Esposito

customer_reviews.title: Great ant farm!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this ant farm! My 5 year old asked for an ant farm because she finds ants so fascinating. This farm has been perfect. She keeps it by her bedside so she can keep a close eye on all the activity. As a side note, this is a great company and they stand behind their products. Any questions and concerns were answered promptly and clearly. We will be back for more, I'm sure!
customer_reviews.author: Leah Levine

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and Great Support
customer_reviews.text: I received the ant farm quickly (which does not come with live ants). However, it was easy to order the ants because there are instructions in the package. Our ants are now digging away and they are so cool to watch. Evviva even reached out to me to make sure that I was satisfied with the purchase, sent me a PDF with fascinating info about ants and has been available to answer questions I had about farm care. Thanks!!
customer_reviews.author: Henry Glover

customer_reviews.title: Fun for a little while
customer_reviews.text: My son really enjoyed this for his 6th bday. It was fun to watch the ants but unfortunately Once they make all the tunnels (and some die in the tunnels) it loses some fun. Not a long term item. We had to throw it away after 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: jamie

customer_reviews.title: Just go ahead and buy it
customer_reviews.text: This little ant farm has been a highlight in our house for months now. We have already gone through our first batch of ants and have ordered another batch. Easy to assemble and a great upgrade to the traditional ants farms that we used to have back in the day!
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah Jones

customer_reviews.title: Looks cool but ants hate it
customer_reviews.text: Ants hate this thing . It’s cool for a day but that’s it . I tried making holes for ants to dig as suggested but they just don’t move unless you take the lid off and blow into it . Then they stop moving agin a few minutes later. Never made any real tunnels after 3 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Dan D

customer_reviews.title: Educational and fun, great customer service
customer_reviews.text: This is worth paying a few extra dollars for. The whole family is loving watching these ants build their tunnels. The blue gel holds up really well, even when knocked over by small children :) very educational and fun. We had a defected LED light on ours and the owner messaged to apologize and sent a new product. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alie Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Is My House Too Hott?
customer_reviews.text: We were so excited about this. My daughter has been collecting bugs in my Tupperware and that’s no bueno. We keep our house at 75 and the gel seems to be “melting” about 5 days in, we started noticing the ants sliding between the side and gel and just dying there. There were about 40+ ants and it’s been a week and we only have about half that. They have barely dug anything either..
customer_reviews.author: brandon

customer_reviews.title: It didn't even last 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I would like a refund. My niece who is a scientist followed all the instructions. The ants began dying almost immediately upsetting my great nephews. Is the blue gel poisonous? I felt bad for the ants in that death trap.
customer_reviews.author: so

customer_reviews.title: Grandkids love it
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than I expected, but works great. The grandkids love checking out what the ants are doing every day... lots of new tunnels, etc. Good education for them. And the light coming up from the bottom is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: MLTyndall

customer_reviews.title: She Loved It !
customer_reviews.text: It was a birthday gift and she absolutely loved it. It was a great surprise gift. Instructions were easy to follow and it fits easily on her desk at work. Love it's compact size. Good to know she can call you with questions. Ants must love it also because they are tunneling away like there's no tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Tim & Charlie

customer_reviews.title: My 6 and 8 year old sons love their ant farm
customer_reviews.text: My 6 and 8 year old sons love their ant farm. It is "very cool" and they are excited every morning to see the progress the ants have made. I was nervous at first, but the instructions said it could take 24-48 hours an edit was just about that. NOTE: The ants DO NOT COME with this and are purchased separately by mail. They ran about another $20 because of expedited shipping and a cooling package that we needed for summer temperatures.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Boyd

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t even know where to start! Customer service is absolutely amazing! My base wouldn’t fit good into the actual ant farm, I emailed them and they shipped a new one out immediately and it came within a day!! The ant farm itself is super cool! Lights are so bright and pretty. Ordered ants and they came pretty fast, all alive and started tunneling with hours!! This is a great gift for people of all ages!!!
customer_reviews.author: Holly H.

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun.
customer_reviews.text: We got out ant farm yesterday and added the ants. Today the ants started their tunneling which was quite interesting last night. Each child poked into the gelatin and last night we all decided which poke they would follow for their first tunnel. This mornings excitement was finding out which poke they had taken. Lots of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Wriven

customer_reviews.title: Fun and educational
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. The harvester ants we used started digging tunnels within one hour of being put in the habitat. We placed them in the fridge for 10 minuets prior to that as it slows them down. I find the blue light that encourages them to dig rather blinding, so don’t stare at the habitat for too long or simply turn the light off.
customer_reviews.author: Agnes B

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase and fast shipment
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my 8-year old grandson. So far he loves it and the ants are working hard too. He is also using it as a night light for his room. Great purchase and fast shipment. Highly recommend this Seller.
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: Ants are expensive and arrived dead
customer_reviews.text: Product is fine what they don’t tell you is to buy the ants is six dollars but the shipping expedited it was over $30. We went though Evviva Science that they recommended. Said thee day delivery and delivered in 5 with no notification - all ants dead. Contacted to have resend and they said we would be responsible to pay almost 30 dollars again for shipping. Totally unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Jolie Vigh

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: This is such an amazing thing for my son. He is 7 going on 8 and it is really neat every day to see the progress the ants have made. Makes for a nice night light as well as being a great scientific teacher that is fun. I am sorry I did not think to get a picture; I will try to add later. This really is such a good plan.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Rizor

customer_reviews.title: Very Cool!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this habitat for my granddaughter - she loves it! She's having a lot of fun watching the ants carved their tunnels and create their homes. It appears well built and glows with a very pretty light that acts as a night light in her room. Very happy with purchase! Customer service very attentive also!
customer_reviews.author: J. Weingartz

customer_reviews.title: Great as a gift for the whole family.
customer_reviews.text: What an awesome gift! I love it! And further more my daughter is fascinated with it. It’s amazing how the substrate glows blue internally. Watching the seemingly tireless ants go about their business has been quite entertaining. And the people behind this product stand by it... I had a problem with mine and they took care of it right away. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki L. Charbonneau

product_meta.title: Ant Habitat W/ LED Light. Enjoy A Magnificent Live Ecosystem At Your Home. Suitable For Kids & Adults. The Best Ant Farm Equipped W/ Enhanced Blue Gel. Evviva Educational & Learning Science Games
feature_bullets: HIGHEST RATED AND BEST ANT HABITAT: The cool blue LED lights give the kit extra awesomeness! Apart from making it look beautiful, the lights encourage ants to dig further, creating huge, intricate tunnels! This live ecosystem will be a magnificent spectacle for your kids and is bound to be their favorite educational-science game! Batteries are not needed or included with our product. The LED light simply needs to be plugged into a standard electric outlet using the included power adapter.

AN AMAZING ANT HABITAT KIT WITH DISCOUNT FOR ANTS: Our LED light Ant Habitat Kit comes complete with all the tools you need to fully explore, observe and learn about how ants live and create their homes! Each ant habitat kit features a cool magnifying glass to see your ants at work, a little stick to help ants start digging! Please note that the ants are not included in the purchase, however, with every science kit you get instructions as to how to order healthy and very active harvester ants!

THE MOST INTRICATE TUNNELS YOU EVER SAW: That’s right! We take pride in the quality of our educational games and that’s why our ant cosmos features an enhanced blue gel that is far more nutrient rich than any other ant habitat available on the market! This premium blue gel will enable the ants to live far longer and dig deep, really intricate tunnels! This not only makes it perfect for science fairs, but also for your own entertainment and educational purposes!

INCLUDES EDUCATIONAL ANT SCIENCE E-BOOK: Did you know that the largest ant colony on Earth is over 3000 miles? Well, you can learn all about exciting ant facts, amazing experiments and all sorts of impressive information about ant biology with our e-book that comes with every ant habitat purchase!

IN EVVIVA WE TRUST: We strive to provide you and your kids with the best educational games we possibly can. However, we do want you to feel safe in your purchase and that’s why each ant habitat is covered by a 100% Money Back Guarantee in case you’re not 100% Satisfied! So get your lab coats and science hats on and enjoy and enjoy and amazing science experience!
